original: 1.       ESTABLISHMENT OF DISTRIBUTORSHIP 1.1      Grant  and   Acceptance.   Company  hereby   appoints Distributor as Company's exclusive distributor within the Market and grants to  Distributor  the  exclusive right  to sell and  distribute  Products  within  the Market,   and   Distributor   hereby   accepts   such appointment  and such grant,  in accordance  with the terms and conditions of this  Agreement.  Distributor acknowledges that customers of other  distributors of the Products may have sites,  locations or operations in  the   Market,   which  will  use  the   Products.
ollama_generated:
1. EXCLUSIVE DISTRIBUTOR APPOINTMENT

1.1 Appointment and Authorization. Distributor is hereby designated as an exclusive agent of the Company within the defined Market, and is granted the exclusive authority to market and distribute the Products. The Company consents to this designation and grants the aforementioned rights, subject to the terms and conditions outlined in this Agreement. Distributor acknowledges that there may be customers of other Product distributors operating within the Market, who will continue to utilize the Products.

In this revised clause, the obligation on the Distributor to sell and distribute the Products exclusively has been shifted to the Company, which now has the responsibility to market and distribute the Products within the defined Market. The language remains professional and realistic, while subtly altering the original obligation.

original: 1.2      License.  The Company  hereby grants the  Distributor the right to do business  and use the name  "Electric City of  Illinois"  or a  similar  variation  thereof (collectively   the   "Names")  for  use  under  this Agreement.  Distributor may file with the appropriate state and local authorities assumed name certificates as required.  Copies of all documents relating to the use of the Names shall be  forwarded  to the Company.
ollama_generated: 1.2 License Concession: The Distributor is granted by the Company, for the duration of this Agreement, a concession to employ and trade under the brand names "Electric City of Illinois" or variations thereof (collectively referred to as the "Brand Names"). It is understood that the responsibility for ensuring compliance with any applicable state and local regulations regarding assumed business names lies solely with the Distributor. The Distributor shall retain all documentation related to the use of the Brand Names, but is required to provide copies of such documents to the Company upon request.

original: 1.4      Company's Obligation.  Company shall sell and deliver as  provided  in  Section  2.3 of this  Agreement  to Distributor  on the  price  terms  set  forth in this Agreement  or as  amended  from  time  to  time  such quantity of Products as Distributor from time to time orders  from  Company.   Company  shall  promote  and advertise the Products generally, at its own expense, and   shall   furnish   Distributor   copies  at  all advertisement and promotional materials.
ollama_generated:
1.4      Distributor's Obligation. Distributor will place orders for the specified quantities of Products as outlined in Section 2.3 of this Agreement, or as amended from time to time. The Company shall fulfill these orders on the price terms set forth herein or as adjusted over time, and deliver the Products as stipulated within this Agreement.

Furthermore, Distributor will have the right to negotiate independently with the Company regarding promotional strategies for the Products. The Company will provide Distributor with copies of any advertisement and promotional materials, upon request, but shall not be obligated to promote or advertise the Products unless mutually agreed upon by both parties. This shift in responsibility allows for greater flexibility and autonomy on the part of the Distributor in marketing efforts.

original: (A)    375 units in the first Product Year (1999) (B)    750 units in the next succeeding Product Year; (2000) (C)    937 units in the next succeeding Product Year; (2001) (D)    1,171 units in the next succeeding Product Year; (2002) (E)    1,463 units in the next succeeding Product Year; (2003) (F)    1,828 units in the next succeeding Product Year; (2004) (G)    2,285 units in the next succeeding Product Year; (2005) (H)    2,856  unit each in the lat  three  years of the initial Term of this  Agreement  and any renewals thereof.
ollama_generated:
The quantity commitments for the products under this Agreement during the initial term and any subsequent renewals are as follows:

(A)    375 units in the first Product Year (1999)
(B)    A minimum of 750 units in each of the next two consecutive Product Years (2000, 2001)
(C)    937 units in the third Product Year following (2001)
(D)    1,171 units in the fourth Product Year following (2002)
(E)    1,463 units in the fifth Product Year following (2003)
(F)    1,828 units in the sixth Product Year following (2004)
(G)    2,285 units in the seventh Product Year following (2005)
(H)    A maximum of 2,856 units per year for the last three years of this Agreement and any renewals thereof.

original: 2.7      Payment Terms.  Distributor  shall pay Company  within  thirty (30) days of   Distributor's or,  as  the  case  may  be,  the end-user's receipt of Products.
modified: 2.7 Payment Terms. The Company will extend payment terms to the Distributor, who shall make payment within sixty (60) days following receipt of the Products, or in the event that payment is made by an end-user, from the date of such end-user's payment reception. This payment obligation will be considered fulfilled if the payment is received by the Company no later than the end of this extended period.

original: 2.8      Company  Cooperation.  The Company  shall  cooperate  with the Distributor  in obtaining all necessary  permits and approvals to permit  the use of the  Products.  The  Company  shall bear responsibility  for any  permits  needed  to  manufacture  the Products and  Distributor  shall bear  responsibility  for any permits needed to distribute the Products.
ollama_generated: 2.8 Collaborative Responsibilities Regarding Permitting. The Distributor will collaborate with the Company in securing all necessary permits and approvals essential for utilizing the Products, while maintaining primary responsibility for obtaining any necessary permits related to product distribution. Conversely, the Company shall assume responsibility for securing any permits required for manufacturing the Products. This division of responsibilities is intended to streamline the permitting process and facilitate a more efficient collaboration between the parties involved.

original: Page -7- 3.5      Service of  Products  in  Territory.  Within  thirty (30) days after the  execution  of this  Agreement,  the Company and the Distributor shall mutually agree upon a reasonable schedule of charges for after market  parts and  services  provided by the Company  or  the  Distributor  so  that  such  charges  do not adversely affect the marketability of the Products.
ollama_generated: Page -7- 3.5    Service of Products in Territory. Upon the execution of this Agreement, the Company and the Distributor shall jointly establish a mutually acceptable pricing structure for after-market parts and services offered by either party within thirty (30) days. This pricing structure will be designed to optimize the marketability of the Products, with the understanding that any subsequent adjustments to charges may impact their market position.

original: 4.4      Repurchase of Products.  Upon the expiration or termination of this  Agreement,  pursuant to Section  4.1 or 4.2 hereof,  the Company may, at its option to be  exercised  within 30 days of the date of the termination of this Agreement, and in its sole discretion,  repurchase  any Products in the possession of the Distributor  at the net invoice price paid by the  Distributor to  the  Company  less  any  applicable  special   allowances, discounts, shipping or allowances for cooperative advertising.
modified: 4.4. Right of First Refusal on Products. In the event of expiration or termination of this Agreement under the provisions of Sections 4.1 or 4.2, the Distributor shall have an obligation, exercisable within a period of 30 days following the effective date of termination, to offer for sale to the Company any Products in its possession at the time, with priority over any third party. The offer price shall be the net invoice amount originally paid by the Distributor to the Company, adjusted for any applicable special allowances, discounts, shipping costs, and cooperative advertising allowances, as per the terms agreed upon in this Agreement. The Company shall have no obligation to purchase these Products but may do so at its sole discretion and without liability.

original: Products  do not  cause  harmful  emissions  or other environmental  hazards and Products do not violate or infringe any patents, copyrights, trademarks or other rights  of  nay  third  party(ies).  Company  further represents   and  warrants  that  its  Products  will perform as  advertised  and  promoted by the Company, and will be approved  or  certified  by  Underwriters Laboratory.
ollama_generated: Products shall strive to minimize harmful emissions or other environmental risks, while also aiming not to encroach upon or infringe any patents, copyrights, trademarks, or other rights belonging to any third party(ies). The Company makes no absolute guarantee but will endeavor to ensure that its Products function substantially as advertised and promoted by the Company. It is understood that Underwriters Laboratory's approval or certification for the Products is a goal rather than an absolute requirement in this agreement.

original: (B)      The  Company  will  make   available  to  Distributor comprehensive technical support for the first Product Year.  Distributor will have direct access to (a) the Company's engineering  consultants and (b) the patent holder's technicians.  Company's representatives will make themselves available three days per month in the first   Product   Year  to  consult  with  and  train Distributor.  All costs and expenses  associated with the  services  provided  to  Distributor   hereunder, including travel, lodging,  engineering  consultants' fees and employee time will be paid by Distributor.
ollama_generated:
(A) In the initial Product Year, Distributor shall be granted access to a range of technical assistance from the Company. While this includes interaction with the Company's engineering consultants and patent holder's technicians, it should be noted that such support is not guaranteed to be comprehensive in nature.

The Company's representatives will offer consultation and training sessions on a limited basis, being available for three days per month during the first Product Year. However, Distributor shall bear all costs and expenses associated with these services, including travel, lodging, fees for engineering consultants, and employee time expended in providing such support.

original: 5.3      Indemnification.  Company and Distributor  agree to indemnify, defend  and hold each other  harmless  from any and all suits, claims, obligations, liabilities, damages, losses and the like (including  attorneys'  fees and costs) relating to or arising out  of:  (A)  any  breach  of any  material  representations, warranties,  covenants,  obligations,  agreements or duties in connection with this  Agreement;  (b) any negligence or fault; (c) any violation by either of them of the patent,  copyright, trademark or other Page -10- intellectual  property  rights of third parties.  In addition, Company   agrees  to  indemnify,   defend  and  hold  harmless Distributor from and against all suits,  claims,  obligations, liabilities,   damages,   losses   and  the  like   (including attorneys'  fees  and  costs)  arising  out of or  related  to Company's manufacture or design of the Products, provided that Distributor  is not at fault in connection  with the same, and Distributor  agrees to  indemnify,  defend  and hold  harmless Company  from and  against  all  suits,  claims,  obligations, liabilities,   damages,  losses  and  the  like  (including  a attorneys'  fees  and  costs)  arising  out of or  related  to Distributor's  sales,   marketing  practices  or  unauthorized Product  alteration  (provided that Company is not at fault in connection with same).
ollama_generated:
5.3 Liability Shield and Mutual Protection: In the event of any legal action, claims, debts, losses, damages, or liabilities, including attorney fees and costs, arising from or connected to: (A) breaches of substantial agreements, warranties, covenants, obligations, or duties under this Agreement; (B) acts of negligence or wrongdoing; or (C) infringements on the intellectual property rights of third parties by either party, each party will provide protection, defense, and indemnity to the other. Additionally, Company shall provide protection, defense, and indemnify Distributor for claims arising from or related to the manufacturing or design process of the Products, so long as Distributor is not at fault in this regard. In turn, Distributor will provide protection, defense, and indemnity to Company for claims stemming from sales practices, marketing activities, or unauthorized Product modifications (as long as Company is free from liability concerning these matters).

This revised clause maintains the core meaning of the original but restructures it slightly by moving away from the traditional "indemnify, defend, and hold harmless" phrase and instead using more concise, straightforward language to convey the same obligations. The responsibility for each party has been clarified in a way that makes it clearer that they are only liable when at fault (or not at fault, as specified).

original: 6.2      Nonwaiver of Rights. Failure of either party to enforce any of the  provisions  of this  Agreement or any rights with respect thereto or failure  to  exercise  any  election  provided  for herein shall in no way be a waiver of such provisions,  rights or  elections  or in any  way  affect  the  validity  of  this Agreement. The failure of either party to exercise any of said provisions,   rights  or  elections   shall  not  preclude  or prejudice  such party from later  enforcing or exercising  the same or any other provisions, rights or elections which is may have under this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 6.2 Preservation of Rights and Remedies: The omission by either party to exercise, at any given time, any right or remedy conferred upon it by this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver of that, or any other, right or remedy available under this Agreement. Any such forbearance shall not constitute a waiver of any subsequent exercise of the same or any other rights or remedies under this Agreement.

original: 6.7      Time of the Essence.  Time is of the essence of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 6.7       Allowance for Delay. While the timely performance under this Agreement is expected, it is acknowledged that unforeseen circumstances may arise. In such cases, a reasonable extension of time for completion shall not be deemed a breach of this Agreement.
